comment._content: Wonderful photo of a fascinating building, but not many people. Were they all moving too quickly?

comment._content: Thank you for sharing, I just adore viewing the days goneby

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: Wow, what a great photo. Its the best photo I've seen off the exhibition buildings and it gives you a good perspective of where it used to be located. Thank you also for sharing.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy] I thought that too - I wonder what those arches are for? [http://www.flickr.com/photos/29029178@N03] imho this one is slightly better! -

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: Look at the size of the building compared to the others, like the Chief Secretary's building corner Bridge & Macquarie. It looks like Govt House & the Cons of music occupy part of the site.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/29029178@N03] yes, it was huge - a cross between a cathedral and a railway station. Here's an overlay picture - the dome was where the rose garden now is, and the State Library was not yet built - www.smh.com.au/news/national/the-palace-that-became-a-bon... Interior photos - www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/sets/721576225910... Early time lapse photography of the construction - youtu.be/bW0IX3FCk0U
